moves.1. e4: The second game of the year and I am coming to this game after a long line of losses.
moves.1... c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. c3: Delayed Alapin , I have tried this earlier . Black can response with Nf6 and then I will have to worry about the e pawn . White would like to play d4 and black will try to stop
moves.3... a6: Stops Bb5+, But  the bigger plan could be a queen side pawn storm .
moves.4. d4: As planned and happy to play this without resistance !
moves.4... cxd4 5. cxd4 e6 6. Be2: I dont know the right square for the Bishop , But wanted to castle , play safe , develop
moves.6... Be7 7. O-O Nf6 8. Nc3 O-O 9. a4: This idea is stop b4 , and if possible play a5 and put a Knight on b6
moves.9... b6: Black has decided to  get the light Bishop to the long diagonal ( decided when he played 5..e6). But this move creates a few weak squares ??
moves.10... Bb7 11. Bd3: to support e4 and play Qe2 to target the a6 pawn , and force black to play a5
moves.11... Nbd7 12. Be3 Rc8 13. Qe2 Nb8: white looks  better ? Blacks two pieces are tied to protecting the a6 pawn
moves.14... Qc7 15. Rdc1: hmm .. was that the wrong Rook on d file ?. at this point I am getting tempted and looking for ways to play e5 ....or /and d5
moves.15... Qd7 16. Rfd1 Rfe8 17. Bg5: I considered giving up the Bishop for Knight and then e5 ?
moves.17... h6 18. Bh4 Rc7 19. Bg3: a new diagonal for my Bishop
moves.19... Rec8 20. Rca1: too many wasted moves . This move  allows me to play my Knight , without worrying about Rxc1 or Qxa4
moves.21... Ne8: now I know white  is better ..... I started asking myself 'How can I lose from here ?"
moves.22. d5: I love this move ... with blacks pieces very very uncordinated  and very few on the king side , I thought I could blow up the king side with my active pieces. I also saw the tactical 22.. exd5 23.Bf5
moves.23. Bf5: getting the exchange ! and I was hopeful of getting the pawn back
moves.23... Rc7xc3: Black decides to get the pawn ...But I think My Bishop is much powerful than this Knight ..and I was happy
moves.24. bxc3 Rxc3: The Rook cannot do much damage alone , so  I left it here !
moves.25. e6: ! destroying the king side and taking control of all light squares.Rest of the moves were forced and I think I got the right continuation

players: Kumar, Mihir (1872) vs. Zhu, Alexander Lawrence (1832)
